page.title: 13Churches in Evie
page.content: There are sites of several previous churches in this area, but the Old Church,which is now used as a bus garage, was built on the geographical centre of the parish. Families walked over the fields and hills to a noonday service, taking their lunch with them, so that they could stay on for an evening service. The present church, built in 1897 as a United Free Church, is now Church of Scotland. The minister preaches once a Sunday and also serves churches in two other parishes. There are just over 100 communicant members, but the average Sunday attendance for worship is about 35. The building is bright and cared for. Music is provided by an electric 2-manual organ. Organisations consist of the Sunday School and Women's Guild. The church is still seen as a basic part of the community.
